meanings.definition: To break into and steal from a building or home.
meanings.sent1: Last night, the thief was caught burglarizing a house down the street.
meanings.sent2: Burglarizing is a serious crime that can result in jail time.
meanings.sent3: The cartoon character was caught burglarizing the cookie jar in a funny scene.
meanings.sent4: The storm was like a burglarizing wind, sneaking into homes and taking valuables.
meanings.sent5: The image of the masked figure burglarizing the mansion was etched in her memory.

meanings.sent1: The burglarizing of the jewelry store was captured on camera.
meanings.sent2: She was arrested for her involvement in the burglarizing of several homes.
meanings.sent3: The comedy movie portrayed a hilarious case of mistaken burglarizing.
meanings.sent4: The rise in cybercrime felt like a digital burglarizing of personal information.
meanings.sent5: The news report detailed the alarming increase in neighborhood burglarizing incidents.
